headline: Workday Stock Falls. Wall Street Isn’t Taking Kindly to Co-Founder’s Return as CEO.
summary: Co-founder Aneel Bhusri has returned to the company to succeed Carl Eschenbach as CEO.  Eschenbach stepped down Monday after a rocky two years at the helm of the enterprise-management software company.  The board deemed Bhusri the right person to lead the company in a software environment being disrupted by artificial intelligence.

content.title: Workday Stock Falls. Wall Street Isn’t Taking Kindly to Co-Founder’s Return as CEO.
content.summary: Co-founder Aneel Bhusri has returned to the company to succeed Carl Eschenbach as CEO.  Eschenbach stepped down Monday after a rocky two years at the helm of the enterprise-management software company.  The board deemed Bhusri the right person to lead the company in a software environment being disrupted by artificial intelligence.

headline: Salesforce Wins US$5.6b Army Deal As Government Role Expands
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) secured a US$5.6b contract with the U.S. Army to provide digital and AI-backed solutions for mission-critical operations. The company also joined the EMBERPOINT public-private partnership with Lockheed Martin, PG&E, and Wells Fargo to support wildfire response capabilities. These developments expand Salesforce’s presence in government, public safety, and infrastructure focused use cases beyond its commercial customer base. For investors watching NYSE:CRM, this move...
